japanese:
おお～！
見てください、いい天気ですよ！
昨日の嵐が嘘みたいです！
translation:
Oohh!
Look, the weather is great!
It's like yesterday's storm never happened!

japanese: ホントだ！　空が綺麗！
translation: It's true! The sky's so pretty!

japanese:
はあ……。
どうなることかと思ったけど、
あっさり通りすぎてくれてよかったわ。
translation:
*sigh*
I was worried about what might happen,
but thankfully it passed by so quickly.

japanese: 昨日は一日中、勉強になっちゃったけどね。
translation: Even though, we studied all day yesterday.

japanese: でも時間はまだある。
translation: We still have some time left.

japanese:
そうよ！
迎えの船は午後に来るんだから
少しくらいは遊べるはずだわ。
translation:
That's right!
The return boat will come in the afternoon,
so we should be able to play a little.

japanese:
じゃあ海に行こう！
やっぱり夏なんだし泳いでおかないと。
translation:
So, let's go to the beach!
Since it's summer, we've got to
go swimming at least once, right?

japanese:
いや待て、昨日あれだけ荒れてたんだぞ？
まだ波が高いだろうし危険だ。
translation:
Hold on, the storm yesterday was really bad, remember?
The waves are probably still high. It's dangerous.

japanese:
あ……。
そっか、そうね海はダメね。
translation:
Ah...
I see, you're right. 
The ocean's off-limits then.

japanese:
じゃ、じゃあ他に何か！
ええと、ええと……うーん……うーん！
translation:
Th-then, something else!
Let's see, let's see... Ummm...ummm!

japanese: そんなに必死に考えなくてもいいだろ。
translation: You don't have to think that hard.

japanese: でも……。
translation: But...

japanese:
安心しろ、さすがに今日も勉強と言うつもりはない。
昨日はお前たちも真面目に頑張ってたしな。
translation:
Take it easy, I don't plan on making you study
today too. You all did your best yesterday.

japanese: ……これじゃ、来た意味がない。
translation: ...In that case, there was no point in coming here.

japanese: は？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
フータローにお礼をしたかったのに、
むしろ、ますますお世話になっちゃった。
translation:
We wanted to thank you with this trip,
Futaro, but you ended up just taking
care of us even more.

japanese:
らいはちゃんにまで、
おやつを作ってもらってしまいました。
translation: Even Raiha-chan made snacks for us.

japanese:
えっ？
だって、頑張ってたから応援したくて。
translation:
Huh?
But you were all working so hard. 
I wanted to cheer you on.

japanese: らいはもこう言ってるし気にするな。
translation:
Even Raiha is telling you not to worry.
So please, don't worry about it.

japanese:
いや気にしちゃうよ。
今回は仕方ないとしても、
また別の形でお礼をさせてほしいな。
translation:
Well, I do worry about it.
Even if you say we can't do anything about it.
We'd like to express our gratitude in another way.

japanese: 上杉さん？
translation: Uesugi-san?

japanese:
い、いや、わかった。
またの機会だな。
translation:
I-it's nothing, okay, I understand.
At the next opportunity, then.

japanese: （本当は、気持ちだけでも充分なんだが……）
translation: (Even though just the sentiment is enough...)

japanese:
お兄ちゃん。
今思ってること、ちゃんと言ってみたら？
translation:
Big bro.
What if you said what you're thinking now?

japanese: らいはっ！？
translation: Raiha?!

japanese:
なんですなんです？
気になりますよ？
translation:
What, what, what?
I'm so curious!

japanese:
そ、そんなことより！
おそらく島の周りの海も波が高いはずだ、
迎えの船が来られるのか不安があるな。
translation:
M-more importantly! The ocean around the island 
probably has some strong waves, so I'm worried
about if the return boat will be able to make it here.

japanese: 言われてみれば……。
translation: Now that you mention it...

japanese:
大丈夫かな？
ちょっと連絡来てないか確かめてくるね。
translation:
I wonder if things will be okay?
I'll check if we've gotten any messages.

japanese:
一花、お帰り。
どうだった？
translation:
Ichika, welcome back.
How'd it go?

japanese: ええっとね、それが……。
translation: Umm, about that...

japanese: やっぱり遅れるのか。
translation: So the boat's going to be late.

japanese:
遅れることには間違いないかな。
やっぱり今回の嵐の影響で
船を出すのが難しいんだって。
translation:
Yep, definitely.
As expected, it's tough to send a boat out
because of the storm.

japanese:
だろうな。
２、３日は様子見ってところか。
translation:
I see.
I guess it'll be another two to three days.

japanese: そんなにですか！？
translation: TWO OR THREE DAYS?!

japanese: ということは。
translation: Which means...

japanese: フー君ともう少し一緒にいられる？
translation: We can stay here longer with you, Fu-kun?

japanese:
それがね、２、３日じゃすまないみたい。
天気はいいんだけど、島の周りの海が大荒れで
船をいつ出せるかわからないんだって。
translation:
Well, it'll probably be a bit longer than two or three days.
The weather's nice, but the ocean around the island's
so choppy, they don't know when a boat can come out.

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese: 少なくとも２週間くらいは難しいって……。
translation: They said it'll be at least two weeks...

japanese: なっ……。
translation: Wha...?

japanese: ええええええ～っ！？
translation: HUUUUUUUHH?!

japanese:
に、に、２週間！？
２週間もかかるの？　嘘でしょ！？
translation:
T-T-TWO WEEKS?!
It's gonna take two weeks? You're KIDDING?!

japanese:
つまり私たちは、この島に
閉じ込められてしまったわけですか！？
translation: So you're saying, we're stuck on this island?!

japanese: そんな……２週間もここで……。
translation: That can't be... Two weeks here...

japanese: 少なくともってことは、それ以上もあり得る。
translation: At least two, meaning it could be even longer.

japanese:
無理！　無理だわ！
私たちだけでどうやって生きてくのよ！
translation:
Impossible! That's IMPOSSIBLE!
How can we live here by ourselves?!

japanese:
そうです！
食べ物も飲み物もないのですよ！？
translation:
That's right!
We don't have any food or water!

japanese: 落ち着け、叫んでも無駄だ。
translation: Calm down, screaming won't help.

japanese:
落ち着けません！
命に関わる問題なのですよ！？
translation:
I can't calm down!
This is a life-threatening situation, you know?!

japanese:
まさかバカンスがサバイバルになってしまうなんて
想像もしていませんでした！
translation:
I didn't imagine that our vacation
would turn into SURVIVING HERE, of all things!

japanese:
（当然だが、みんな予想外の事態に混乱してる。
　俺だってそうだ）
translation:
(Naturally, everyone is confused by this unexpected
 turn of events. Even me.)

japanese:
なんてこった！
ど、どど、どうすれば！？
translation:
Oh NO!
Wh-wh-wh-what do we DO?!

japanese:
もう、フータロー君まで取り乱して。
気持ちはわかるけどさ、ここは男の子に
頑張ってほしいかな。
translation:
My, even Futaro-kun has lost his cool.
I understand how he feels, but I'd like
for the only man here to try harder.

japanese: うん……。
translation: Yes...

japanese:
…………。
すまん、そうだな。
頭を抱えてる場合じゃない。
translation:
......
You're right, sorry.
I shouldn't be freaking out.

japanese:
（当然だが、みんな予想外の事態に混乱してる。
　俺だってそうだ）
translation:
(Naturally, everyone is confused by this unexpected
 turn of events. Even me.)

japanese: らいはを巻き込んじまった……。
translation: I can't believe I got Raiha into this...

japanese:
よかれと思ったんだけど、
まさかこんなことになるなんて。
translation:
I thought everything was okay,
but I never thought something like this would happen.

japanese:
すみません！
私が誘ってしまったばかりに！
translation:
I'm sorry!
I was the one that invited you!

japanese:
ううん、そんな！
誘ってもらえてすごく嬉しかったよ？
translation:
Don't worry about it!
I'm so glad that you invited me.

japanese:
（当然だが、みんな予想外の事態に混乱してる。
　俺だってそうだ）
translation:
(Naturally, everyone is confused by this unexpected
 turn of events. Even me.)

japanese:
（だが、混乱のまま右往左往していたら
　迎えが来るまで生き残れない）
translation:
(Yet, if we keep going in circles with this confusion,
 we won't be able to survive until we get picked up.)

japanese:
（落ち着け、冷静になるんだ。
　こんなところでこいつらやらいはを
　失わせるなどあってはならない！）
translation:
(Calm down. Don't lose your head.
 I can't lose the girls or Raiha
 in a place like this!)

japanese: みんな、聞いてくれ。
translation: Everyone, listen.

japanese: フータロー君？
translation: Futaro-kun?

japanese:
状況を整理しよう。
まず迎えの船は、少なくとも２週間はこない。
そのあいだ、俺たちだけで生き抜く必要がある。
translation:
Let's sort things out. First, the return boat
won't come for at least two weeks. In the meantime,
we'll need to survive here by ourselves.

japanese:
それはわかってます。
でも、どうやって……。
translation:
I understand.
But, how can we...?

japanese:
簡単なことじゃない。
それでも全員で協力し、
なんとか成し遂げなくてはならない。
translation:
It won't be easy.
However, if everyone works together,
we can get it done.

japanese: だから、ここは俺に任せてくれないか？
translation: So, would you leave things to me?

japanese: えっ？　上杉君にですか？
translation: Huh? To you, Uesugi-kun?

japanese: もしかして、こういう経験あるの？
translation: Have you done something like this before?

japanese: 無論ない。
translation: Of course not.

japanese: ないんだ。
translation: You haven't?

japanese:
ないが、この困難に対し
誰かがリーダーになり団結する必要がある。
俺がもっとも適任だろう。
translation:
No, but for a problem this serious,
someone needs to be a leader to unite everyone.
I believe I am the most suitable.

japanese: それは……。
translation: Well...

japanese:
確かに、私はどうすればいいのかさっぱりですけど、
上杉さんならなんとかしてくれそうです。
translation:
I have no idea what to do, that's for sure.
But Uesugi-san might be able to do something.

japanese:
ああ、必ずなんとかする。
お前たちの命とらいはの命を預かるからにはな。
translation:
Yes, I definitely will.
I'll make sure you girls' and Raiha's lives
are all taken care of.

japanese: フー君……！
translation: Fu-kun...!

japanese: 私はフータローになら全部、預けるよ。
translation: I'll entrust everything to you, Futaro.

japanese: 私もフー君に任せるわ！
translation: I'll leave it to you too, Fu-kun!

japanese: だね、むしろフータロー君しかいないよ。
translation:
That's right, more like,
only Futaro-kun can do it.

japanese: よろしくお願いします、上杉さん！
translation: It's in your hands, Uesugi-san!

japanese: 私も上杉君に協力します。
translation: I will also cooperate with you, Uesugi-kun.

japanese: お兄ちゃん、責任重大だね。
translation: Big bro, what a strong sense of responsibility you have.

japanese:
ああ。
だが、やり遂げてみせる。
translation:
Yeah.
However, this time I'm gonna follow through.

japanese:
さっそくだが、まずは食料と飲み水だ。
どれだけ備蓄があるのか確認するぞ！
translation:
Right off the bat, our first priority should be food and water.
We need to check how much is stored!

japanese: フー君、倉庫にあった食べ物のリストできたわ。
translation: Fu-kun, I made a list of food that's in storage.

japanese:
備蓄はあまりありません。
そもそも滞在予定が３日でしたから。
translation:
There's not much stock right now because,
we were only originally scheduled to stay here
for three days.

japanese:
いや、逆にこれだけあるのが驚きだ。
多めに用意されてて助かったな。
translation:
On the contrary,
I'm surprised there's this much here.
It's a huge help that there's already so much prepared.

japanese:
飲み水はどうしよう？
温泉のお湯？
translation:
What should we do for water?
Water from the hot springs?

japanese:
いえ、ここの温泉は酸性が強いので
飲み水には向いていません。
translation:
No, the hot springs here are very acidic.
They won't do for drinking water.

japanese:
だったら、別荘の裏にある滝か
川から汲んでくればいいよね。
translation:
In that case, we could get it from the waterfalls
or the rivers behind the villa.

japanese: となると、食べ物かな。
translation: And then, there's the food situation.

japanese: ああ、島中から食べられるものを集めよう。
translation: Yes, let's gather things we can eat on the island.

japanese:
あ！　そうそう、それなんだけどね？
この島って今は無人だけど、
昔は人が住んでたんだって。
translation:
Ah! Yes, about that.
This island is uninhabited now,
but people used to live here.

japanese:
その人たちが植えた野菜とかくだものが
そのままになってるって聞いたことがある。
translation:
I've heard that the fruits and vegetables
that people used to grow are still around.

japanese:
あと、港に魚がたくさんいましたよね？
釣りをしたら簡単に釣れそうです。
translation:
Also, there should be are a lot of fish at the harbor, right?
I bet we could catch some fish pretty easily.

japanese:
なるほど。
いけそうな気がしてきたな。
translation:
I see.
I'm starting to feel we can do this.

japanese:
ええ、こうして落ち着いて考えたら
無理じゃなさそう。
フー君に任せてよかったわ。
translation:
Yes, it doesn't seem impossible,
thinking about it calmly like this.
I'm glad we left it to you, Fu-kun.

japanese: その台詞は島から出られたらにしてくれ。
translation: Save your praise for when we get off the island.

japanese:
これで食料については一段落だな。
もう１つ、俺から提案がある。
translation:
That checks off food but...
I have one more suggestion.

japanese: なに？
translation: What?

japanese: 迎えが来るまで勉強もするぞ。
translation: We study until the boat comes.

japanese: は？
translation: Wha?

japanese:
あの、上杉君？
さすがに、それどころではないのでは？
食料を集めなくてはならないのに。
translation:
Um, Uesugi-kun?
I really don't think this is the time for studying.
Don't we need to gather food?

japanese:
その日に食べる分を集めるわけだし、
全員そろって行く必要はないだろ？
translation:
We just need to gather food for that day, right?
Not everyone has to go out.

japanese:
そうかも。
たくさん集めても食べきれなくてもったいない。
translation:
That might be true.
If we gather so much we can't eat it all,
it'll be a waste.

japanese:
だから食料集めは手分けするとして、
残ったやつは勉強するんだ。
translation:
Therefore, we'll split food-gathering duties,
and the rest of the group can study.

japanese: いや、なんでそこで勉強？
translation: Oh no, why do we have to study?

japanese:
まあ聞け。
こういうときこそ、平常心を保つためにも
普段通りの生活を心がけるべきだ。
translation:
Just listen.
In times like these, to maintain a sense of normalcy,
we should strive to live our daily lives as we do every day.

japanese:
普段通りに勉強をすることに意味がある。
なによりも、継続しないと学力が下がる。
夏休みが明けたら成績が急降下なんて笑えん！
translation:
It makes sense to study as usual. Above all, if you
don't continue to study, your academic ability will fall.
It'll be no joke if your grades plummet after summer break!

japanese:
ですね、３年生に進級したときみたいに
頭がリセットされたら困ります。
translation:
That's right, it would be a problem if my brain reset,
like when I became a third-year student.

japanese:
……わかったわ。
フー君なりに私たちのことを考えてくれるんだもの。
translation:
... I understand.
Fu-kun is thinking about us, in his own way.

japanese:
そうだね。
勉強もやろっか。
translation:
I see.
I won't neglect my studies, then.

japanese:
そうだ！
やるにしても目標がないと張り合いがないよな。
よし、迎えが来る前にテストをやろう。
translation:
Here's an idea! If we study with no goal in mind,
it'll feel like a waste of time.
Okay, I'll give you a test before the return boat comes.

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
問題は任せろ。
俺がお前たち１人１人に合わせて作ってやる。
translation:
Leave the test questions to me.
I'll make your tests custom-made for each of you.

japanese: ちょ、ちょっと？　テスト？
translation: W-wait? A TEST?

japanese:
いいのではないでしょうか。
平常心も学力も保てるのなら一石二鳥です。
translation:
Isn't that nice? If we can maintain both a stable mind
AND our academic abilities, it's two birds, one stone.

japanese: 私も上杉さんのやる気に応えてみせますよ！
translation: I'll match your drive, Uesugi-san!

japanese: でも、テストまでやる必要あるかなぁ？
translation: But do we really NEED to have a test?

japanese: ある！
translation: Of course!

japanese: 言い切った。
translation: You really said it, Futaro.

japanese:
ご不満なようだが、
お前ら、さっき俺に任せると言ったぞ？
確かにこの耳で聞いたぞ？
translation:
You complain, but you guys JUST said
before that you'd leave it to me.
Is that not what I heard with my own two ears?

japanese: うっ、それを言われちゃうとなんとも。
translation: Ooh, you got us there.

japanese:
わかったわ。
テストに向けて勉強もする。
translation:
I understand.
I'll study for the test.

japanese: 私もちゃんとやる。
translation: I'll study as hard as I can, too.

japanese: 頑張りまーす。
translation: I'll do my beeest.

japanese:
よーし、さっそく行動開始だ！
この島で見事に生き残ってみせるぞ！！
translation:
Alriiight, let's get moving then!
We are going to SURVIVE on this island!

japanese: おーー！！
translation: YEAAAH!!

japanese: フータロー君、テンションおかしくなってない？
translation: Futaro-kun, aren't you a little too over-excited?

japanese: そういえばフー君ってこういうところあったわね。
translation: Come to think of it, Fu-kun's just that kind of guy.

japanese: でも、頼りになることには変わりないよ。
translation: But on the other hand, he's just as dependable as ever.

japanese:
どうしてでしょうね、
本当になんとかしてくれそうな気が
してしまうのは……。
translation:
I have a feeling that,
Futaro will find a way to figure it out...
